I can't, however, give it  5 stars. The staff are extremely friendly. The actual hotel is huge and feels like it is 'outside' of the city. The breakfasts are better than the dinners.  The 1st night in the hotel, my air conditioner was making a terrible noise the 1st night. I called downstairs and they sent a maintenance man up to fix it. It wasn't 100% but at least it was better and the management did

MTN Strategy Session in Balmoral hall was conducive for the purpose and the staff were readily on ground to assist.  Though the convenience was far from the hall, the hall is situated outside the hotel building on grounds close to the reception , we had to walk up to the reception area to use the convenience. I would advise a close alternative.

my kids loved  the food. The swimming pool is  big plus for families with kids and my kids did not want to leave the pool! the food was very very nice with plenty varieties. the mattress is very good and made sleeping at night such an awesome experience.

Stayed at the Federal Palace several times this year, and each time I leave with same observations. Overall it's acceptable, but I find a few things irritating - the hotel won't send you an iron and ironing board to your room, they'd rather iron things for you. Bathrooms are very underwhelming and urgently need renovation. I always seem to get a room overlooking a busy/ugly area looking like the roof of the hotel restaurant (avoid such rooms), and there's always noise there. There's also constant electricity outage and the associates noise of the generator. The breakfast spread is generous, though there are never bananas (which I always look for to grab with me), and it seems impossible to get an apple - have to get permission of the chef himself. Gym is very good though,

Review Title: Excellent Business lunch with FNCCI and MEDEF
Review Text: we had a business lunch with the French Nigerian Chamber of Commerce and Industry and the French MEDEF, we really appreciate the great service, the great food, we will come back. The view on the garden and the lagoon was nice.

I stayed at the Federal Palace for six nights on a business trip, and have mixed feelings about it.   The hotel occupies a large plot over-looking Lagos Lagoon. This is less romantic than it sounds as the view is quite industrial but interesting if you like watching large container ships and tankers which pass very close by.   There's very little of interest in the immediate vicinity of the hotel (but that's probably true of many Lagos hotels) and you wouldn't want to try strolling outside the hotel. The hotel seems very secure, with good vehicle security and plenty of security in the lobby.   The public areas of the hotel are very spacious and nicely furnished. Bedrooms are comfortable but nothing special. The hotel is in a good state of repair and most things seemed to work,

I stayed at the Federal because I was looking for a different experience from my previous visits to Lagos. I requested for a sea-view room - which I got but it was on the 2nd floor and there was a view of a low-level building within the hotel premises. Keep this in mind when you book. Then there were the incessant fire alarms. There were no fires nor was anyone alarmed. I was told that sometimes it is triggered when guests smoke in non-smoking rooms! Otherwise I enjoyed my stay. The staff were very helpful and courteous. Despite the rough edges, I would consider visiting again due to their warm welcome and help during my stay.

Review Title: Need to improve but great sea view
Review Text: Stayed 3 nights with my wife in November. This hotel promises so much but delivers very little. First of all check-in was easy and straight forward but after that I had to complain about the strong smell of cannabis in the corridor for 3 nights and nothing was done about it.....Very terrible!! Also no iron or ironing board in the rooms, upon request I was told I needed to pay for my clothes to be ironed....Seriously??? Then the issue of random people just roaming the hotel and it's environs just made it seem like a public place than a 5star property. Lastly...the buffet served every night was just below par compared to other 5star properties I have stayed in Lagos.  I honestly feel the hotel can do more to improve what I have mentioned above as it promise to best one of the best

This tops the list of hotels in Lagos for me.   Courteous staff, clean rooms, excellent amenities, good food n wide variety too. Breath-taking view (from my room), awesome background music to soothe your soul. Did I say courteous staff?
Review Text

Stayed in this place three nights whilst on business in Lagos. Very friendly atmosphere, and a lovely decor. When entering there, after a busy day, one feels like out a noisy city like Lagos. Rooms are comfortable, and wide. The view of the ocean is beautiful.Staff very friendly and professional.

I was a long term guest whilst on a business trip to Nigeria.  The Federal Palace is by far the best hotel in Lagos.  It is situated in the heart of Victoria Island (the CBD) yet you would not know it.  The hotel has large immaculately kept gardens which border the lagoon and as such you are shielded from the noise of Lagos.  It is hard to believe that you can find peace and quiet in Lagos but this is the place!  The facilities are first rate.  The pool is large and ideal for swimming lengths.  The tennis courts are in excellent condition.  The gym is well equipped and air conditioned with plenty of cold water and fresh towels. The public spaces are ideal for business meetings with the comfortable seating spread far enough apart so that you can conduct your meeting in relative

I stayed here with my family for 3 nights and it was a lovely experience. My children loved their swimming pool - designed for all ages with very shallow areas for children and the deep end for experienced swimmers. The swimming pool slides were such fun even my wife and I look forward to reliving the experience. The hotel is built by the sea and atmosphere here is beautiful. You can just walk around the greenery by the secure seaside - especially after a meal since there is an access directly from the restaurant. Let me summarise the experience:  Location Right in the heart of high brow Victoria Island and very easily accessible  Checking In Very easy and professional  Rooms Nice, neat, cosy etc. Very comfortable beds and pillows. I find their rooms too cold - even when the ACs

Stayed in this hotel several nights and overall, as the title says, the stay was just "okay." While the hotel tries to compete with other high end hotels, it needs to step up its game in several areas.  First, when the hotel does decide to do a renovation, something it is currently in need of, the guest room bathrooms should be first on the list (see photos).  The bathrooms have one of the mid-90's design elements - a half door on the shower with no shower curtain or full enclosure.  This is a huge mistake.  To take a shower means spraying the bathroom with water to the point of near flood.  I used every last towel trying to mop it up before leaving my room for the day.  Second, the breakfast buffet.  Every morning when I went down to breakfast, it was hit and miss as to whether

I stayed here with my family for 5 nights before moving to another hotel for 2 nights for logistical reasons and I wished I did not have to move.  The hotel is a modern well maintained luxury hotel in lagos and provides the same level of service you would expect at all the larger luxury brands.   They offer a great breakfast buffet with plenty of choice both continental and nigerian and have what looks like a really nice pool, my kids didn't use it because the weather was awful during our stay but they really wanted to.   The staff are friendly and welcoming, the hotel has plenty of parking which is free for short stays/pickups i.e. less than 20 minutes and they charge for anything longer than that. It is in a decent part of lagos but there was always a lot of traffic on the

Sun International Casino & Hotel. Old building, in need of some TLC. Comfortable rooms, warmly decorated. Food is very tasty. Service is friendly, but not always efficient. Rates are fair, compared to competitors. Olympic size swimming pool AND Supertube! Nice views of the harbour.

Breakfast is ok..rooms are ok..BUT you are not allowed to take photos of the threes outside in the garden...we were reported to the management üòÇüòÇüòÇ you are also not allowed to fall asleep in the lobby waiting your shuttle..we were warned and one hotel staff kept an eye on us so that we don't sleep üòÇüòÇüòÇ

Nice hotel to be, good rooms and environment, you can also decide to take a room with the water view. The only annoying part is having to request for parking fee always before you are allowed to drive out even when you are on a visit

The location was good, the room was good, the breakfast was excellent, the wifi connection was ok. So, why am I not going to stay here again? The trouble started when I was entering the hotel with two bottles of water, bought from the neighbouring supermarket. Security at the entrance stopped me, saying that I wasn't allowed to bring any food or drink from outside into the hotel, as the same stuff was available in the hotel at extortionate rates. I told them that I hadn't seen any notice anywhere saying I couldn't do this. They called the manager, made me stand around in the lobby for 5 minutes till the manager came. The manager finally arrived, repeated the same thing, and told me that as a special favour he will allow the stuff I had bought, but he would not allow this in

We came to nigeria to visit family and rather than fly to Abuja to enjoy the last days there my uncle recommend this hotel. From the moment we check in I felt like this was a real holiday that me my husband and young son could enjoy. The lobby was amazing and big we met all our friends there with no one to bother us. The breakfast was great anything you wanted they had. The room was large and perfect for a family. We had a great view of the harbour. The outside grounds was beautiful from the peacocks to the swim area that my son loved to the great views. I have recommended this hotel to many and will definitely visit again when I come to nigeria
Review Text

Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights to enjoy our remaining time in nigeria after spending time with family.  I have to say this hotel was amazing the lobby was beautiful the breakfast was yummy so many different things on offer.  The room was a great size for a family of 3 and the staff was well mannered and friendly. I will definitely come and stay again when I come to nigeria

Stayed 10 days while visiting our office in Lagos. Excellent location with a sea view. Very high service standards, from the moment you step into the lobby. Frontdesk is very helpfull and did a good job meeting our request.  The pool club is nice, quiet during the week but even in the weekend when most pool club members are visiting it never felt crowded. The pool could have been cleaner though.  Food- and Beverage Manager George Dairy was very kind and helpfull and did everything he could to ensure that our stay was as pleasant as possible.   Certainly a recommendable hotel in this fantastic city!

First time stayed at this hotel. Stay was better than I expected. Nice lobby, helpful and courteous staff one even recognized me by name. Peacocks and peahens give you company for breakfast. Meals are average and breakfast is a lack luster affair as you have to summon the waiters to get you tea. Fruits are not replenished though the eggs were good. Nice location if you are offered a room with a view. Lots of other choices in Lagos hence may or maybe stay here next time.

The rooms and the food are very and the rate i got was good value for money when I stayed. Location is excellent for VI. Staff well trained and accommodating. Pool is very nice and general setting with the garden pleasant.

I stayed here for my last night in Lagos, I have to say that it still remains as charming as ever. The rooms feel slightly dated however, and due to that fact, it felt overpriced. Also for the modern traveller, it was hard to locate enough sockets for devices to be charged. A revamp and modernisation could be the difference.   Also wifi was a bit patchy. However breakfast and the checking in area were amazing. Also felt secure due to the armed security.

Thank you to the federal palace hotel and casino for a fantastic weekend, it has always been a home away from home.  A shout out to your staff and management for there friendly nature and always ready to assist. I would recommend your hotel to anyone perfectly located and amazing premises, Thank you Mr David Kiegl for running such and amazing hotel.

I was at the federal Palace Hotel for swimming and the hotel is so fine. Clean water, green gardens and nice barbecue. Took some nice photo with friends and people think it was abroad. Niceeeeeeeeeeeeeeereeeee memory

Review Title: Trip was all Business but facilities and amenities availbe to please and entertain
Review Text: Hotel is secure and grounds are well maintained. Excellent park like setting with a workout area and swimming pool. Professional staff who attend to your needs. Rooms were clean spacious and well maintained. Hotel interior fabulous local art and design.

Stayed here with my husband and two children to celebrate my birthday. It's a well known hotel in Lagos that's been in establishment for many years however it recently got renovated. The lobby is quite impressive and luxurious. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The food is okay, and the rooms are also okay. Best thing about this place is the free use of the exclusive waterpark in the hotel. The kids (and adults) had a great time in there and we were able to take in some friends as well. Glad I stayed.

The Federal Palace Hotel, Lagos is a hidden gem. This foremost 5 star hotel is a must have luxury experience.   I love the size, ambience, serenity despite its strategic location, service and cuisine.  The hotel caters mainly for business people and has up to date world class facilities to make your stay in Lagos fulfilling.
Review Text

I stayed at this hotel twice over a 3 week period in March.  Both times received professional and courteous service.  George the Beverage Manager is exceptional.  He went above and beyond to accommodate our requests and ensured we were well attended too.   The food at the breakfast buffet and in the bar restaurant was very good. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Lagos.

Stayed here with my family for 5 nights while my father was on business. Well cleaned rooms, very practical but not fancy. Breakfast was good with nice outdoor spaces. Otherwise poor eating options. The pool facilities were good overall however the staff were were and not courteous. They lazed around as if you owed them something. A solid hotel overall, don't expect anything fancy: but hey, it's Lagos.

We were welcomed by attentive and friendly staff, also offered a non-alcoholic cocktail during check-in.   Breakfast buffet/dinner buffet at the hotel is excellent and included many delicious dishes.  They accommodated for our baby by supplying a high chair at the restaurant and a cot in our room.  Hotel is in a good location, able to walk around to nearby bank (For ATM) or shopping mall for restaurants, smoothie bars etc.  Overall a very enjoyable stay. Will definitely come back!

i really enjoyed my stay, the food was great and fresh, great views, spacious room and the security was good and tight. All the staff are dedicated especially the concierge dept. some of them put guests first before family, Thank you Benjamin for coming to the international airport with a diligent driver at 06:30 AM after your night shift to confirm the driver's identity and to confirm your own identity because the transport was arranged very,very late. "The In room service and Laundry dept" are not something good to write home about. Over-all I had a fantastic time especially in the beautiful garden with the colourful friendly peacocks roaming freely.

Rooms are small and has a sligth unpleasent odor, room food service is not thst good. Uncomfortably Very crowded. The garden is nice, the service in lobby is slow. I really didnt get a good experience

What a fantastic stay! The best hotel I've stayed at in Lagos, or anywhere in Nigeria for that matter. I cannot fault this hotel on anything - very friendly, competent staff, spacious rooms with good amenities, excellent food (very interesting, tasty "marinated" fresh fruits at breakfast). The only thing during my stay was that the pool was closed for maintenance. This I do however not see as a negative as it shows they do at least maintain their property, which cannot be said of all hotels around here. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lagos.

The Federal is an interesting place. The ambience is colonial a Africa but 1970's style. The rooms are pleasant and most have a great view to the lagoon. They are a bit run down and old and the plumbing requires your patience but the mini bar is stocked. The lobby area, bar and terrace are very nice indeed as are the various peacocks that roam freely. The garden is very pleasant but the pool not what it should. The staff are genuinly warm and helpful and security is good. The F&B is of a very poor quality although served ceremoniously and is ultra expensive. Not a bad choice but there are better and more economic choices in Lagos. The hotel recently has lowered the room rates in what I understand is a bid to get more business.

Review Title: It was a lovely hotel. Excellent service.
Review Text: The Food is amazing, The Facilities are clean and functional, the pool, the tennis courts, the mini golf course, the game center, the restaurant, the LOBBY... Very Cool (Literally) lobby. It was an all round great experience. they even had enough grounds for me to take a walk in. plus a functional ATM. Theres a cinema right beside the hotel so no stress plus theres a jetty closeby just incase you're going to a beach. The water front is great....

The staff are warm and go an extra mile to please you. Large grounds to walk, the pool and slides are amazing.  Well mowed lawn.  We had an amazing time. The food at the buffet is delicious with both contemporary and local selections.  Lots of dessert options. They have rooms with adjoining doors especially for families. Weekend promos and special holiday promos. The children loved the pepperoni pizza,  chicken and chips,  sandwiches and sugar from the  pool food stall.   Suggestions: Wouldn't hurt to set up a small permanent play area for children, that way they can enjoy their stay as they get tired of the pool area and want more.   Kindly provide at least a single cupcake, card or any gesture to acknowledge birthdays,  wedding anniversaries for your hotel guests.   A spa and

Excellent service from all staff, nothing to small to attend to.  Security of hotel excellent felt safe and secure throughout stay.  Hotel presentation emaculat, from entering the hotel down to the rooms.  Outdoor swimming pool in beautiful surroundings and clean.  Food fabulous and service also.  Only reason I didn't give a five star rating was down to the stained carpets in the hallways to the hotel rooms.  No issue with the room flooring though.  Also the bathroom door was slate in style ie like a Waldrobe door, hence it lacked total privacy.    Would return for sure.
Review Text

Review Title: Nice hotel with lots to explore
Review Text: We checked in December 30 with our son for a family getaway for 4 nights. The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable. We didn't order any other food apart from breakfast as we ate out a lot but they have a very generous breakfast spread with lots and lots of variety. Tastes good too. They've got a wide variety of activities: a lovely pool area with different sections, mini golf course, game arcade, bouncy castle, tennis court. I'm sad we didn't explore it all. They've also got large expanse of land where you can take walks or take in the lovely view of the water. We definitely enjoyed our stay and will definitely consider coming again.

Was here with my family again in late December into the New Year.  As usual it had a few activities for kids like the water slide and pool area which was almost over crowded, a game room and a bouncy castle just sit up for the season.  Check in was very poor as the rooms I had paid for were given up but after complaints and a demand for a refund, I was eventually granted two sea facing and interconnecting rooms which is what I had earlier requested for and paid for in advance.  Breakfast at the hotel was above average with a fair amount of options to choose from.   Overall, our stay was fine as it provided the kids lots of fun activities.

Review Title: Good value for money but dodgy staff
Review Text: Room was nice with sea view, and the bathroom was clean and modern. Breakfast was great. There was a variety of international and Nigerian dishes, and it was included. Hotel is well designed and d√©cor is updated. The waitresses are very nice and the food and drinks were great. Check in was easy. The outdoor dining area is very nice and breezy with good food; burgers, fried prawns, jollof rice etc.  The pool is large and clean. My husband enjoyed the casino. Location is great. It is a few feet away from silver bird cinemas and shops. I walked over to silver bird one day. I'd advice foreigners to use and uber instead.  CONS: The lobby tried to make us pay in USD at the terrible hotel exchange rate. Pay in naira. WIFI was included but was not initially provided due to technical

When in Lagos, I drop by to the Casino. Lovely place with very attentive staff and you wont feel left out. This is the best casino in Nigeria by far. Their finger food is great too and unlike other casinos they do not cringe if you ask for a comp drink.

Review Title: Year in Year out- Still one of the best hotel to stay in Lagos
Review Text: My second review of this hotel. Good for price, location and service Great lovely staff that make you feel very welcome. The rooms are well decorated and everything works, Clean, storage area,decent bathroom and  The supplies were re-filled and towels/bedding changed. Breakfast was lovely with a wide  selection of English, continental and local foods  Coffee and juices are also available.The hotel is close to all the key business areas and dinning out for Lagos Island, Victoria Island and Ikoyi. Great place to stay , Highly recommended

Review Title: Good hotel, great pool area, and superb service
Review Text: The FederalPalace hotel is well situated. It has a casino, yet is still a quiet place to stay. Great breakfasts, and a huge pool with water slides. The bar is friendly and well stocked and reasonably priced. The rooms are spacious and well fitted out with all necessary supplies and amenities.

The rooms are comfortable but  the bathrooms look a bit old.  For a 5 star would have at least expected separate showers instead of the in the bath.  The breakfast buffet was rather limited in terms of offerings and when ordering the club sandwich from room service the portion was very small for the price compared to what I have come to expect from other hotels.  the beds however are extremely comfortable

I love this hotel.  the ambiance, the breakfast, the POOL!!!  The staff are quite welcoming, and remembered me from when I used to live in Lagos, and was a member of the Pool Club.  It made me smile to walk through the hotel, and different stay exclaim "Madam, Long Time!  Welcome!!!" :-D The gym is in a weird location, but other than that . . . always a nice stay.

Stayed for 6 nights and basically enjoyed the stay. The breakfast is good and the dinner buffet is not ( although I had a very good steak during the last night ). It must be great when the hotel opened many years ago and now it is aging reasonably well. Service is good but beware of exchange rate when settle bill in by Amex....

Nice place to stay. Clean. Helpful staff, good food. The swimming pool and allied activities are good. Probably one of a kind in Lagos. Location is convenient from shopping and restaurants. I think the staff can be a bit more welcoming, smile more.
Review Text

I've stayed here a number of times. I still find this to be an excellent business hotel - the rooms are nicely appointed, quiet (very NB), with decent air conditioning. Room service also pretty decent - had an excellent burger after checking in late (after 11pm) on a Sunday evening. Only disappointment was that mini-bar was not stocked. But the key thing is that rooms are comfortable, ensuring a good nights sleep. The breakfast buffet is also very good.

Review Title: Lovely views, excellent gym but smaller rooms and a bit dated
Review Text: I stayed for 4 nights on business.  The view from the back of the hotel is beautiful, overlooking a green lawn with some trees and the ocean/harbour.  There is an outdoor swimming pool with slides, which unfortunately I did not get to use.  The hotel is somewhat dated and the rooms are small but adequate.  They are very clean, which I consider very important. The breakfast buffet is extensive including an egg station.  There is a large gym with lots of equipment - both cardio and weights.  However, you have to go out the hotel, down some stairs and through another door to reach it.  A hotel staff member was always on duty when I passed out of the hotel and I also saw military police nearby, presumably to ensure the safety of guests.    There is really only one restaurant in the

I stayed at the FPH with my wife and kids over 5 days from the end of July into August 2016.  I must say I was very impressed with the hotel which is now managed by Sun International.  The hotel is set in very large grounds, a beautiful lawn, a peacock and then a pool club with water slides which the kids couldn't get enough of.  The rooms are small in the hotel though we had inter-joining rooms which was great. Rooms are actually quite cozy and insist on getting the sea rather than city facing rooms.   Breakfast was average with good choices of meals and even a pasta station which I found interesting. Lunch is not very rich in options though much cheaper than breakfast which I found strange.  The hotel also has an excellent lobby, small gym and then the bar area is also the

Federal Palace customer service was absolutely brilliant.Definitely one of the best hotels in Lagos.We all had a great time. I am looking forward to my next visit.  Everything about the hotel was sublime, I really hope they keep up the good work.

Very great place, international and a lot of activities for children and adults! I advice you to go there, week ends, hang outs ...  it has a mini golf, a huge pool, restaurant, bar and rooms, you can be a member or guest, go for business or just a family day out...

I always have a great time whenever I am traveling in Lagos, Federal Palace have excellent service, I really enjoy the food and the hospitality in the hotel. If you are in Victoria Island I highly recommend that you check out this hotel and enjoy Nigerian hospitality.

The Federal Palace is definitely my favorite hotel in Lagos. It's in a great location near in my opinion, some of the best restaurants and clubs in Lagos.   While the Federal Palace isn't the most modern hotel, its definitely a classic. The hotel is definitely not as modern and cutting edge as a lot of newer hotels but its charming.   I'm probably a bit biased though because it reminded me of traveling with my parents as a child and checking into what I thought were "big" hotels and looking round in wonder.   The grounds are definitely more "resort" like and I personally love that the pool and golf course is situated a bit away from the hotel (and I love the area for the kids). It adds to the classic feel and the view from the poolside is absolutely gorgeous, especially around

Great attention to guest needs. I had an exceptionally pleasant welcome beginning from the bellman to the receptionist. A complimentary glass of pineapple juice was served while check-in was in process and everyone was very polite and eager to help.  The room I stayed in was clean with a comfortable bed and fantastic view of Victoria Island. I ordered room service which was prompt and gorgeously plated (iAppreciate stuff like that). I recommend the bitter leaf soup with fish. The bathroom was spotless plus and the complimentary bottles of water came in handy.   Bottom line, this is the best hotel experience I have had in Lagos and I recommend making reservations here if you are in the city.

The Federal palace Hotel on Ahmadu Bello Way is a really nice hotel with an excellent locatoion. It has lovely staff, a nice menu and an active ambiance around it. The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable

A good 4 star it can be, if the Management decides to upgrade the property. No doubt about the location, it is beautiful overlooking the waters provided you get a room facing it. The security, entrance and lobby is good, warm welcome by staff is good, but had a dirty linen on my bed, stained curtains, dusty lamps, etc. put me down. The view from the room was good in the morning with peacock family waking you up. Breakfast was OK, don't be amazed by some casual staff who were lost sometimes.
Review Text

Review Title: Functional but not what I expected
Review Text: I stayed here for two nights. Overall, not bad, but certainly not memorable. For the price I had higher expectations.  The room was a good size, and bed was comfortable.  However, the bath was missing its plug, and I battled to communicate with housekeeping to get one.  I found the pillows too high, and having requested a flatter pillow, I got one that had such bad stains on it, that they showed through the pillowcase.   The breakfast had a good variety, but if you want a special coffee (cappuccino / latte etc) it is an additional cost!  Although variety was good, the food was mediocre.

Had a Business Lunch at the Federal Palace Hotel on a weekend (Saturday) and it was a very wonderful experience that surpassed my general expectations. It was time to have our lunch and the meals were hot and tasty. The staff on duty were cautious and very professional in their conduct. I hope to visit this restaurant very soon!

Had a breakfast meeting and was pleased at the variety of choices served at the buffet.   You have a choice to either dine in or outside. Dining outside gives you a view of the river and the peacocks prancing all around you.  Lovely experience and would love to spend some more time there.

My stay at the federal palace was amazing! it simply felt like home. I had everything either in my room or at my beck and call. With their state of the art amenities and facilities, it was more like a holiday for me as i had so much time to relax, have fun and tour the vast expanse of beautiful resort that is the federal palace.

Review Title: A very nice getaway amidst the hustle and bustle of Lagos
Review Text: Spent the 1st night with hubby and then we added the kids to the mix for the rest of the weekend.  All I can say is upon entering the hotel lobby, I smiled and felt extremely relaxed.  All the stress and constriction I had on the other side of the door just melted away.  The pool, the spacious grounds, the food, and kids playgrounds, the peacocks......LOVELY EXPERIENCE

Just a 1 night stay. It is on Victoria Island about an hour and a half from Airport. Coming back early next day to airport took just 20 minutes....beat the traffic is the answer. Nice open grounds with sauntering peacocks. Good views over to city. Fab outdoor swimming pool with 2 water slides.  Had buffet in evening which was good. A mix of local and other cuisines. Didn't visit the casino. Rooms very nice with everything as it should be.

A good venue to host your business meetings. We were treated well by the banqueting staff. The amenities were on point. Our guests from out of time were impressed. The ambiance is good and relaxing, the meals served were nice too.

Review Title: Can this can be in Lagos ?
Review Text: It is unbelievable that this hotel is in Lagos and kept very secret.  You are likely to forget you are in Lagos as you are ushered through the reception lounge to the elevator. The restaurant serves great cuisine and has a great view, overlooking Lagos Lagoon, The night view is exhilarating as you can see the bright lights of the ship as they dock. The hotel has an Olympic size swimming pool, about 50 meters away from the hotel giving you a total tourist experience. I think I really did not finish touring the hotel...

Centrally located, spacious, good food, very good breakfast, good pool with slides, large green garden overlooking the lagoon, across from the port, casino inhouse. however, staff did not seem excited to see guests.meeting rooms were good and spacious

Review Title: A business or holiday destination in the busy Victoria Island, Lagos
Review Text: I stayed in a room on third floor, which had the standard hotel room facilities and services (a king size bed, mini bar, WiFi, a safe, reading table and an arm chair). The washroom area had a shower above a bathtub. My room though was near the huge air conditioning system just outside my window which made some buzz sound so if you want that quiet rest, choose a floor above third floor.  There are two restaurants, one on the ground floor and another one on the floor below ground floor. The ground floor restaurant is normally open for lunch and dinner while the basement floor usually serves breakfast. The ground floor restaurant is next to the hotel's bar, which serves a wide assortment of alcoholic drinks, soft drinks and fresh juice extracts. The bar is generally a nice place
Review Text

I spent one night at the federal palace hotel two months back and the experience was good. The room we stayed in was standard with a view of the sea. The staff was courteous and service was fast. Visitor parking is not free but can be validated by a guest. Overall, it was enjoyable

My team was part of the social media team for #MotyConcert hosted at the federal palace hotel, the staffs and security are OK making you see the value of good hospitality and the hall is not really big but its one of the best event hall on the island.

Clearly the best Casino in Lagos. Good ambience though a bit on the expensive side, if you don't know how to play you would be lost as like in any place in Nigeria the people who are supposed to attend to you would not be looking at any of the customers, you have to make some sounds to get attention(I don't personally don't like making such noises) , the problem of getting change for whatever you busy is also very cumbersome, the waiters expect you to forget it and leave the change for them!!!The machines are clean and arranged neatly, My personal best is the electronic Roulette without any manual intervention, though some touch screens don't work very well ,

Review Title: Best hotel so far in Lagos
Review Text: I've been a number of times to Lagos and tried many different hotels. This one is certainly the best so far for the following reasons: - Location by the sea - Nice very large swimming pool - Nice rooms - Good service - Nice terrasse for an evening drink Now there are a few annoying things: - The old hotel is still there, like an ugly ruin - A "Lagos Motor Fair" taking place inside the hotel ground! - Only one restaurant open some evenings That being said, this hotel remains a good choice in Lagos. And, yes, it is secure.

From the marble floors & pillars to the exquisite gardens...this is a beautifully presented hotel.I have stayed at the Federal Palace several times & found the standard of service & quality of food consistent on every visit.

Stayed at this hotel off and on for a collective of at least 6 months over the last 3 years:  Location ... Relatively close to business district, night life, restaurants, other hotels   Hotel ... Old building, but kept ok for the backdrop.    Staff ... Mostly friendly and inviting to guests. Exhibit the Nigerian homeliness and respect.  Some of the newer staff need to keep up with the culture.    Menu ... Limited in room dinning selections.  Recently slightly improved over the last 3 years.  But awesone breakfast and dinner spreads  Room ... Housekeeping continues to be a problem.   Bathroom not clean, sheets needed to be changed on multiple occasions.  For the cost, this should be a high end, well maintained, and stellar service + amenities facility, but it falls short on key

I ain't sure whether I have reviewed this lovely empire before but Lemie tell you those Peacocks are interesting. I took the liberty of naming them after it took us hours before I could get over my fear. Uzuri and Urembo.  I've been chased around by an Ostrich and as Beautiful as they were I couldn't shake off my earlier experience.  My favourite food here, mashed potatoes with beef sauce. You can order it in any form you like. Enjoy watching Uzuri and Urembo.

I have stayed in quite a large number of hotels in Lagos over the last couple of months an can't deny that the Federal Palace Hotel is for sure one of the better ones. More expensive as well but for once... it shows off. Everything just "fits" and that is nice. Food was good, room was good and clean... Just a very nice stay. Will go back to the Federal Palace Hotel, no doubt

Review Title: Very nice hotel but bad wifi
Review Text: I had a very nice stay at the Federal Palace. The rooms are clean and spacious and not too damp considering it's in Lagos. The hotel is also quiet. The staff are very nice abs the food isn't bad. There is no spa which was a little disappointing. All in all I would highly recommend the hotel. The only bad point is the wifi which is shocking - very intermittent.

This is part of the Sun International group as a result when you are in the room it has the same look and feel as any other Sun international hotel. The room is comfortable and the breakfast buffet reasonable if you don't mind the same food everyday. The gym is tiny so I skipped it and ran around the hotel grounds on the track/walkway. Use the stairs if you don't want to get stuck in the lift when the power goes off. Nothing amazing but not bad either
Review Text

Review Title: A good, quiet option for Lagos visit
Review Text: As a business traveler I tend to travel worldwide and Lagos is certainly an experience.  You want a hotel with some space from the hectic roads and your room.  The Federal Palace, though somewhat dated, provides a nice buffer for short strolls and some reflection.  The rooms are okay; the beds very comfortable and the restaurant and bar are good.  Certainly would stay there again.

Hotel environs are gorgeous, especially the Pool Club. Casino is smaller than anticipated but very exciting. The food was sumptuous and a surprise birthday cake for the wife. Rooms are very good and averagely spacious.

Review Title: Probably the best hotel to stay in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed in this hotel consistently over he last two years. and its amazing.  Not overly crowded like their competitors Eko or Intercontinental, The lawn and the  lagoon or se view is amazing. Its good place to have business meetings. In the centre of Victoria Island part of Lagos. I frequently lodge my international visitor in the hotel, its safe, the food is good and the prices are competitive

I was super skeptical at staying at this hotel due to some of the past reviews I'd read, but I came here on a recommendation from a colleague and also due to the fact that I wanted to feel safe while staying in Lagos on my first visit ever. While there was some confusion during my check in, that is the only piece of negativity I can actually attribute to the stay. The rooms are super clean and tastefully decorated. The service at the front of the door down to the restaurant is efficient and surprisingly good for West African standards of hospitality...(not particularly known for great customer service). The food in the upstairs and downstairs restaurant is exceptional, and I would definitely consider staying here again during my next business trip in the following weeks.   Good

Stopped here for 14 nights on business in September 2015.  Slightly odd set-up.  Is this a business hotel or a leisure hotel?  Obviously with the Casino and the large Pool/Health Club complex, it has a leisure hotel vibe.  But given that Lagos does not yet have much tourist infrastructure or any significant number of tourists, it feels more like a business hotel.  Generally enjoyed my stay.  Security was good; electricity and water supply reliable enough.  The pauses between mains and generator could be frustrating, they were generally short, but 3 or 4 of them during my stay were in the 2-5 minutes range.  Annoying when in shower (water stops flowing as well as loss of light!).  Breakfast was good other food was fair, although fish, chips and peas on room service menu turned

The children loved their stay and the staff were great. The wife and I also had a much needed rest and took full advantage of the great staff, room service and the restaurant.  From check in to check out the service was five star. Well done to all.

I stayed at the hotel for two nights on a business trip.  The hotel is situated in large grounds on the lagoon and has a great view.  The reception area is large and spacious.  The rooms were a bit small but adequate.  There is not a separate shower in the bathroom, only one over the bath.   The pool is in a separate complex  in the grounds and is a bit like a theme park which is open to the public (who need to pay to get access).

Review Title: Federal Palace will need renovation soon
Review Text: It is known to be one of the best hotels in VI but i have realized during my last stay that the hotel will need a renovation soon. The bathrooms especially. In general the rooms are small but the beds ar extra compfy :) the ourdoor area is good and the service is better than average. If you are booking an ocean view room avoid the 2. Floor or 3rd floor as there is a lot of noise bsc of the air conditioning.

From start to finish I have been blown away by the service of the team at Federal Palace. Over the past 2 weeks I have had the opportunity of staying  at The Federal Palace twice in two weeks.  I found the rooms to be very comfortable and very clean. Loved the fact that they have a walk/running parth set in lush garden environment. Felt very safe.

Review Title: All round great experience and helpfulness
Review Text: The Intercontinental couldn't accommodate me on a prepaid booking so I went to Federal Palace.  From the beginning to end it was a pleasant experience.   I had chosen not to stay at this hotel in the beginning but I will certainly stay here again because everything worked well and it was an all round good experience.
Review Text

Review Title: Not all 5 star hotels are equal
Review Text: I founf the entrance hall impressive.  The check in was easy. I found the room small, but adequate. I was warned not to eat at the hotel unless I had to.  I enjoyed breakfast. Both in room meals I ordered, was not good value and neither was it good quality. Compared to other 5 star hotels, I was disappointed. The first meal was late and incorrect. The second was a very small portion. The hotel has a great foyer and is geared well for business meetings. For travellers who do not want to travel to meetings and have meetings in the hotel, this is a great setting to do this.

Very well decorated hotel. The entrance and rooms are beautiful. The buffet breakfast is excellent with a lot of choice in bread, cereales fresh fruit eggs cheese and many more. The staff is welcoming and helpful. Excellent wifi!

This hotel is a gem away from from the hustle and bustle of Lagos city. It's gardens and pool area are one of the few green spots in Lagos and provides that breathe of fresh air that is often needed when travelling in a chaotic place. The hotel is expensive but compares favourably with the other upper end hotels in the city. Dining at hotel can become a bit boring as the menu never changes and is very limited. Service is slow so don't be in a hurry. Room quality is excellent, the room is clean and I always sleep comfortably. Staff are very willing to help. The fitness centre is adequate and the hotel has a backup generator.

Stayed in Federal Palace for 2 nights. Overall, the service was excellent with very helpful hotel staff. Used the gym facilities which met my needs. The breakfast was excellent and definitely 5 star. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant and the food was top quality. Room was great with sea views. Would definitely recommend. Grounds also have a pool and mini golf area.

I do not think that this is a 5 star quality hotel and it is certainly not worth the money which they are asking for it. Starting with the booking process, I requested a car pickup and airport ‚ÄúProtocol‚Äù service. This resulted in a separate form arriving requesting a lot of personal information (e.g. date of birth) and a photocopy of both sides of my credit card. When I pushed back to say that this should just be added to the room bill and hence providing that information seemed unnecessary they accepted my point and arranged it for me. This worked well and the airport piece was fairly painless (i.e. I did not have to pay any bribes).  When you get to the hotel and check in you are charged for the full cost of the room upfront. I have had cases of hotels ‚Äúreserving‚Äù the money

I have stayed in most of the upper end hotels in Lagos. The FP is probably relatively value for money but it feels old and past it's best... It is well located and has a great feel with lawns and channel to the port in front. Rooms small but comfortable

Large hotel, decent sized conference facility, good pool and water slides, massive lawns and water side garden. rooms were average sized, reception staff were not warm, i was the only person at check out at 8 am and still took 20 minutes, massive property, but not being effectively used. doors were pretty sound proofed. breakfast priced at 8100, ie some 2.5 times in other hotels.

Prefer Wheatbaker and Intercontinental. Better food options, nicer gym with better rooms at these other hotels. FP does have a quick and painless check in. Expensive which is the norm in Lagos. Would stay here if i had kids though as it has a good pool with slides.

There kitchen doesn't close and the chef was so friendly. The outdoor exercise area and the clean pool make my stay even more enjoyable. The wifi works all over the expansive ground and in the rooms. The beautiful rooms with great river views adds to the reasons i will go back there again. On a hot day ask for a Chapman at the pool.

Exceptional good from the room, food, environment and staff.. Room was cozy, just the  want I need rest after business meetings, arguably the best breakfast I had in Nigeria, facilities was good, name it.. casino, bar and my favorite 'The Peacock'..
Review Text

Review Title: Still one of the better hotels in Nigeria...
Review Text: I have visited the Federal Palace hotel many times since the reopening and at one time basically lived there...this is the very best with customer service. The staff are extremely friendly and have been target for poaching by most of the hotels in Lagos. It has a superb foyer, casino and pool club that can compete with the best standards. Located right on the Marina waters...the views are breathtaking. My negatives are with maintenance and lack of a loyalty membership program.

The hotel is in good shape and has an excellent view of the Atlantic Ocean; this can be savoured from the well-kept courtyard; though the peacocks at the courtyard seem to give a better welcoming smile than the reception staffs.

I like big hotels, but often find you can sort of get ignored in ne. But that isn't the case with Federal Palace. The service is great, the rooms are clean, and the have an awesome buffet lunch. Our room wasn't the biggest, but it was comfortable and perfectly adequate. There is a nice family pool on property and the staff are pretty honest. We left some valuables when we left the hotel and they were handed back to me when we went back the next day.

I went back to the Federal Palace after a few stays in other hotels and I still think it's the best option for Lagos. Easy check in, friendly staff, good food and lovely grounds. The Wi-Fi works much better now as well.

A great hotel that offers a calm and tranquil atmosphere. It has an excellent pool complex with slide. Shade was in short supply around the pool as the sun parasols were ineffective. The free crazy golf looks great fun but it was too hot for us in the sun. Also the out door fitness stations were well maintained.   The hotel food and drink was of the usual Nigerian standard, mixed. Some was excellent, the breakfast for instance was fantastic with so much choice. The Friday evening buffet in the restaurant was the best I have ever had in Nigeria. So much choice and such good quality food. However the USUAL buffet served in the bar area was the worst I have ever encountered. We were told this was the normal buffet available most days as the restaurant doesn't open most days!   This

The first time i walked into Federal Palace Hotel, I thought, this simply has to be the most beautiful hotel in Lagos and I MUST shoot here! Being a film maker I always have my eyes peeled for great locations. We approached the General Manager, Mr David Kliegl with a full on presentation and shaking in our boots because we were certain he would say no!  He turned out to be a really cool guy with a great sense of humour and he agreed to give us a generous amount of days to shoot. Let's just say that we have to convince everyone who watches the show that i wasn't shot in some exotic overseas location but right here in Lagos!  The rooms are spacious, the sea views are lovely and the views are lovely. The terrace restaurant at night gives the best view of the Marina that i have ever

The hotel has a wonderful ambience and serenity. In a city that is characterised by lots of noise, you'll wonder about the quiet environment at the hotel. The service was excellent. I enjoyed the fine dining. I'm going back soon to enjoy those steaks again.

The Federal Palace Hotel is one of the oldest luxury hotels in Lagos (probably in Nigeria). Refurbished in recent times, it is now a cool & calm oasis in the midst of this hustling & bustling city. Great swimming pool area, nice rooms, good restaurants and onsite casino and a whole lot more.

Very secure and peaceful hotel in the busyness of Lagos. Everything you need done is taken care of by friendly staff. Casino and gym available. The view from the rooms of harbour from the island it's unbelievable that one is in Lagos.

Sun International has hidden a wonderful casino in the old wing of Federal Palace Hotel and have a kitchen and restaurant befitting of royalty.   The compliment breakfast is really worth coming down for in morning.
Review Text

I stayed in the Federal palace hotel for a week on business trip, the hotel is huge with an ancient design It has a small nice gym a big swimming pool and a casino. The Rooms are quite big, clean with TV and AC. Breakfast (included ) was really good and delicious , but dinner is very expensive not delicious and it takes time to be ready (more than 30 minutes). The stuff is very friendly and helpful. Defiantly a good stay but an expensive one (but I think all the hotels in Lagos are expensive).

Review Title: A mix of old charm and new glamour.
Review Text: This is one of the oldest established hotels on the Island. It still retains this old charm and character. There is a recent addition to one part of it that gives it a new and modern ambience.   We checked a colleague into the room. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. It costs about $500 USD per night. We made use of their business centre to print and scan a document. They were a bit slow but we got there in the end.  The restaurant is at the basement. The peppersoup was hot and spicy. Just as we like it. But I observed that both the peppersoup and the vegetable soup I ordered to go with the pounded yam was heavily laced with thyme and curry. That was a disappointment.  That's an absolute 'No' when making African soups.   Apart from this disappointment, the hotel has a good

I was in rush to enter my car after the driver came up the car port. This was precisely at 9:55 a.m. Local time (GMT +1) on the 8th of December 2014.   I suddenly went down on my back and buttocks as my legs suddenly slipped forward. I took stock of what happened and observed a bevel on the tarmacadam at precisely the center of the car port.   I ensured that I put my experience into writing to the hotel for corrections and prevent future occurance to others.

I stayed at the Federal Palace on business from Nov. 9th to 14th and had a fantastic stay. Great room, great swimming pool, great service from all staff in all areas, housekeeping, reservations, car booking, restaurants etc.   The location is also ideal.  There was only a slight misstep when I settled my bill. My card was rejected due to a connection error in the reader which took a while to be identified, but other than that everything was very efficient and professional.  I'll definitely stay there again when I'mn back in Lagos.

I am in Lagos conducting customer service training and happened to stay in the Federal Palace Hotel.  My staff made the right decision.  We have stayed in a number of Lagos hotels and have to say FP is the best so far.  The customer service in FP far exceeds what we usually receive.  The Internet was not as strong as I like in my room but other than that hiccup everything was great.

Dont stay here, Was first down for breakfast buffet, everything was cold When I complained I was advised it had only just been put out & food warmeres take time to heat food - Nice  Rooms very average, dirty, furniture worn out Matress good if you like a stone floor to sleep   Staye 1 night out of 4 booked elsewhere

Review Title: Great place, great food and great bedding
Review Text: Amongst all the good hotels and places to stay in Lagos, this is by far one of my favorites. The bedding is very confortable and the rooms are quite spacious, the lobby √°rea is vast and very welcoming as well as the check-in facilities (no a counter but rather a private desk), then the food at the restaurant is great and a special mention to the breakfast buffet (you can eat a full meal in the morning which is quite handy when you have to work far from the hotel and finding a restaurant can be quite a problema outside VI or Ikoyi). The staff is always very helpuf and ready to help and for the Casino lovers, there is one in-house, so no need to go around at night. As for families, there is an outside pool and some slides for the better enjoyement of the smaller ones... So whether

I would like to say big thank you to the whole staff working there. My experience in this hotel are hard to express in words. The worm and welcome which me and my boyfriend recived from everyone in hotel was amazing. They made us feel like home. Staff always smiling at you greeting you every time see you is just beyond 5 start hotel expectations. Room on highest level. Food amazing. I can strongly recomend anyone to forget eating outside cause restaurant delivers amazing food not only local but European as well. Every single penny was worth it to spend cause food was just beautiful. What else can I say if you are looking for second home in Lagos go for Federal Palace cause they will always look after you. I hope i will be able to visit them once again in future.

The staff at the palace went above and beyond to best accommodate my needs during my stay. They even took additional measures to protect all hotels guest from ebola. The leadership team at the palace are truly sincere and tried their best to make me feel at home. The amenities along with the garden views create a serene and enjoying experience. The palace is a top notch hotel and I highly recommend staying here if you are visiting Lagos.

I was very pleased with all the staff and management.  Everyone was very kind, pleasant, and helped me to feel at home.  The food was very good at all meals, and if I ever desired something that was not on the menu they were eager to accommodate.  I was very impressed with the chicken curry, and asked the chef for the recipe, and he was kind enough to comply.  This is just an example of the Federal Palace having a family atmosphere.  I felt very safe and comfortable at all times while staying with the Federal Palace.  Thank you Dave, George, and the rest of the staff for making my stay a wonderful experience.  I will come again.  Warmest Regards, Chad
Review Text

I've stayed at the Palace several times. The rooms are good. Water view (request it) is great. Breakfast is incredible but pricey -$35. Wonderful pool - huge, water slide. Kids love it. Good gym and game room for kids. And the view from the balcony on the back side of the restaurant is gorgeous. Apapa ports, container ships sliding past the hotel. Wonderful. The casino - possibly the only one in the city - is fun. Slow during the day but crowds come in evenings and weekends. In all a great place to stay.

Fabulous views, friendly staff and good food! Every time we have been there we have been welcomed and recognised by well the friendly staff. Sunday Buffet is to die for! The views across the harbour from Upper deck are amazing!

I would like to congratulate the Federal Palace hotel and staff for keeping their high standard. this was my 3rd visit in as many years to this hotel, as the leader of a South African business delegation of 30 companies. we went to Lagos to forge business relations between South African and Nigerian businesses, and Federal palace was the perfect place to stay at. The rooms are extremely beautiful, the lobby spacious and luxurious, ideal for our delegation to have business discussions both in groups and in private. The conference rooms are ideal for business events, and most importantly the standard of service is very impressive. special thanks to David the GM of the hotel for his care and hands on professionalism,  special thanks to Nena Okeke the event coordinator for being on

Stayed only one night in this beautiful hotel, but enjoyed it a lot. Staff is very welcoming and friendly, that aspect is really perfect. The lobby is impressive with a warm atmosphere. The rooms are luxureous, excellent bathroom also. I have one comment/suggestion. Make it a bit less cold in rooms and lobby and restaurants. Both my colleagues and myself came back with a cold from this trip. By the way the food I had on this trip in the hotel was also great. On the terrace the sandwich I ate was really great, although it took a while before it arrived. Breakfast was super!

Review Title: Best sleep I've had in ages
Review Text: I'm not sure what exactly it was, but My husband and I agree that we had THE MOST RESTFUL weekend ever!  The staff was great - polite, helpful and friendly. It was my husband's birthday, and the staff helped make it truly special for us. The food was great. The room was very neat and cozy. I have a thing about bathrooms and the bathroom at the hotel did NOT disappoint. Great view (ask for a sea facing room!). There is sooooo much to do at the hotel. I loved the pool. If you just wanna go for a walk‚Ä¶ DO IT - lots of beautiful grounds to cover! Will definitely be returning and this time I hope to win big at the casino :)

Review Title: Not just a hotel, its a Palace!
Review Text: The Federal Palace Hotel has a nice and calm ambience, its a wonderful get-away spot. The food was quite tasty, their staff are very accommodating and courteous. the hotel is very quiet, its a great place to get a quick holiday and rest properly. Business meetings can be conducted with ease, and the hotel management always find a way to work around your needs, even if their policies are against them.

A solid hotel, some of the rooms and especially the bathrooms are dated but everything else works well, the food is acceptable but not startling and the communal areas all are well maintained. You won't be amazed but unless unrealistic won't be shocked either

Review Title: Federal Palace Hotel...Home away from away
Review Text: Form point of arrival, my 2 nights stay at Federal Palace...it was a relaxing experiencing. Despite that it was a business trip, I was so relaxed as the environment gave the right ambience. From the receptionist at arrival and the waiters that attended to me...I was totally Impressed at their politeness.  FPH comes highly recommended by me for any traveler or tourist.  G.A

So, with a mixture of regret and relief, I bid farewell to the Federal Palace. I've spent maybe 20 or 30 nights here over the past few years, but after my most recent trip, I'm calling time now. On the regret side, the staff are friendly and cheerful. They've been consistently the positive side of the property. The relief is that I won't have to face the very sub-standard evening buffet again, the run-down exterior and public areas, the super-noisy aircon in the rooms, and I won't have to wonder why the owners don't swing the priority pendulum just a bit back from the casino where it lies, to the hotel, where it's needed. Net - competition's now strong and present, but in my view the Federal Palace, very sadly, is neither.

They cut out the water with no warning what so ever. Want me to take a bath with a bucket of water. They call them self a 5star hotel and this is what you get after paying a fortune to stay here. Food takes forever to serve and once it arrives the food is cold. Really a bad experience and they should drop there star rating to a 3 star...
Review Text

We recently held the first India Education Fair at FPH and our overall experience at FPH was satisfying and we would recommend others to use the venue for their business meetings/seminars. The staff were very cordial and the food served was excellent.---Vijay Kumar, STPL Nigeria

Stayed at Federal Palace and held our business reviews in their conference facilitates.   Rooms are spacious and clean. Bathrooms need a bit if attention to upgrade things a little.   Reception and communal areas are nice wide open spaces, something that's nice to have when you are in Lagos for a few days, with the grass in the front, that leads to the water (harbour entrance), making you feel like you are not in this exceptionally built up city.  Food has been enjoyable.   The conference area is well situated and while our room has no windows and is a little stuffy as a result, we have been comfortable and happy.

Review Title: An amazingly helpful set of staff, a beautiful setting...
Review Text: From the day we set out to hold my niece's wedding reception at FPH, we were amazed at the helpfulness of FPH staff... nothing was too much for them to accommodate for us.  They worked tirelessly to ensure we got everything we asked for.  The food was superb, beautifully laid out and hot! The waiters and waitresses immaculately turned out and they served us to the very end (and the reception, which started at 1.30pm went on till 11pm)!  The marquee was spotless and nice and cool! I really cannot rate it any higher in my mind or in this review.  FPH, you did us proud, thank you so much. For ANYONE who wants a small, intimate, wedding in Lagos, in a lovely setting, with good food and good service AND chilled champagne, FPH is the place I'd strongly recommend! I can also recommend

I was a bit worried when I was told that I will be staying in this hotel.  This was because I usually see the tall run down building from the outside.  But I was suprised to see a new hotel building within the compound when I arrived.  I spent 5 days in the Hotel during an exhibition within the hotel and I must say it is definately one of the top 5 hotels in Lagos.  The room was clean, well decorated and spacious.  The Pool and garden area is awesome and can get quite busy in the weekend as it's a popular attaction for children.  The negative things about the hotel is that it only has one restaurant which I think is inadequate for such a big hotel, also the one or two 'lady friends' who came be found hanging out in thee bar on weekday nights and the lack of power sockets next to

Review Title: Brilliant venue, brilliant service, fun and fantastic staff!!!!
Review Text: Our daughter's wedding reception was held in the marquee because she wanted the backdrop of the hotel grounds in the wedding pictures. It helped of course that the recently renovated hotel has had the gardens beautifully landscaped into an ethereal experience with the Lagos Port and lagoon providing an unforgettable vision of nature. Add to this the fantastic service we got in the planning of the event.... Special discounts on the 'dodo' the bride wanted, hot TASTY meals (and I emphasise that because absolutely everybody commented on how exceptionally tasty the food was!!!) The ambience, the decor, the service was beyond excellent. A Huge thank you to all the brilliant people who made it so unbelievably fantastic.

I would like to stay that my stay was above expectations! Very nice welcome at check in by Michael who got me a nice room with a view when i told him , it was my very 1st stay! Breakfast is varied and tasteful! Staff is committed and eager to help ! It was a very nice stay in busy Lagos

Lovely, relaxing hotel in a city which is challenging. Reception staff helpful, room large and clean. Pool lovely and refreshing.  That said, the food and drink were alarmingly expensive. Very good breakfast

Gorgeous Hotel. Resort Style. Loved the olympic size pool Perfect water day and night. Cool water slides. Mini golf. Great sea view . Tennis courts. Gym is small but has everything you need. Food on expensive side. Room service pricier than eating in restaurant.  $U.S.15 for a small cocktail! wow. Wasn't expecting it to be expensive in Nigeria. . Gorgeous green gardens with peacocks milling about. Breakfast buffet is worth getting up for. Never got sick once here. Had to stay here for many days on a business trip. Staff is very accommodating and friendly. Area outside hotel is not much to see. Very busy crowded and dirty. There is a mall with cinema walking distance from hotel.  Went to a Chinese restaurant 5 mins from the hotel - excellent food. Free fast wifi mostly

Review Title: One of the nicer hotels in Lagos.
Review Text: This hotel is clean, the service is good, dining facilities are more than adequate and it's good for both business travellers as well as those on holiday. You tend to get quite a few cabin crew using this hotel as well.

I had a really nice stay at the Federal Palace. Was in Lagos for work and spent a few days here. The staff were extremely courteous, friendly and were very helpful. The grounds are nice to take a (short) stroll, with some lovely views over towards Lagos Island. Breakfast was great, with a nice range of choices , and the room was ideal - a really comfy bed! It is expensive, but then everything seems to be expensive here. Internet was fast and reliable too.   I could have happily stayed here longer and will definitely be staying here next time I come to Lagos.
Review Text

I stay at the Federal Palace every time I come to Lagos given the proximity to our office.  With every stay, things get better.  The latest addition of the tray of 'welcome cakes' in your room on arrival is a great touch!  Keep that up!  And a stocked mini-bar is also a welcome addition. I have also noticed that they have taken the comments of airconditioning into account - it was too cold at one stage and this is much better now.  It's in a great location overlooking the water. The one suggestion that I would make that would improve the experience is the fluctuating water tempreture in the showers.  The showers go from hot to cold to hot to cold so you have to keep hopping in and out under the water. Would be great if this could be fixed. But overall, a good experience, with

Review Title: One of the best in Lagos
Review Text: Although all the hotels in Lagos are expensive, the Federal Palace comes closest to giving you what you pay for. Easy check-in, good service, great breakfast. Rooms are nice too and it is very well situated.

I loved my stay at Federal palace. The internet was fast, the atmosphere was very collegial, and the breakfast was amazing! Get to meet the food and beverage manager. Great guy! Oh and the Casino is a must indulge!! Overall great service. Highly recommend it to anyone visiting Victoria Island! It's a true gem!

This was my first stay in Nigeria and I was extremely pleased to have been staying at the Federal Palace. The staff was very friendly and the service was as good as any top hotel in the world! I was upgraded to a large room, which was a nice surprise after a long flight. The staff were attentive and could not do anymore to help.  The rooms were very nice, with full UK and US television. They have huge comfortable beds with very clean and up to date bathrooms. I hosted a business presentation at the hotel and everything went to plan.  The food was delicous as well! Well done!

Review Title: Federal Palace Lagos - Very Nice Hotel
Review Text: The best Hotel in Lagos, clean, calm and has a very friendly service. WI-FI is quite reliable and I can do VoIP calls clearly. Very close to major businesses in VI. Nice Gardens and overlooking Lagos Lagoons. Great Staff and management.

I always stay at this hotel when visiting Lagos, the hotel is in Victoria Island. The hotel is fairly new with all the normal room amenities, flat screen TV, AIRCON, Mini Bar, Free WiFi. The hotel service is consistent, the breakfast caters for a variety of tastes and on par with most five star hotels. The gym is well equipped with Technogym equipment. There is a pool with slides for kids, outdoor obstacle course for fitness fanatics. Try the local restaurants for dinner because the buffet can get tedious after a few days and the menu doesn't change much, there is a la carte menu though if you don't feel like going out. Try Spice Route restaurant if you like Indian/Chinese cuisine, it's on Victoria Island not far from hotel. Hotel has taxis on standby, this can be charged to

I arrived at the Hotel and was pleasantly surprised, lovely decor and a warm and inviting atmosphere. Staff were friendly and always at hand to help. Facilities were up to date and food served offered a variety of native and continental dishes. Surroundings were clean and modern, and rooms were to a high standard, bed and pillows were extremely soft and gave us a great nights sleep. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples and families as there is so much to do and is easily accessible to other areas in Lagos. A great escape from the hustle and bustle not Lagos, as it is a quiet and safe resort.

After staying in some not-so-nice hotels in West Africa, the Federal Palace Hotel was a welcome break. My room was very comfortable and clean, and the bed was wonderful.   The gardens and facilities at this hotel are great - there is a decent gym, beautiful pools, mini golf, and more. There is also a walking path along with water, just be weary that the water is full of garbage...  Food at the hotel is great, especially the breakfast buffet. If you are ordering food a la carte, just be prepared to wait...a while. My a la carte orders typically took 45-60 minutes to be delivered to my table.

Review Title: Hands on manager ensures good service
Review Text: If you need to conduct business in Lagos I would recommend this hotel. There are beautiful Grounds and hospitable service. The food costs were very high though so if you are on an expense account you may have a problem. The Lebanese Manager was always on the floor of the hotel greeting guests and was always available. I can t say there has ever been a hotel manager providing this degree of service. My only comment is that if you order room service the prices in the room dining book aren't accurate. For example in room dining for two Oceans wine was 4000 naira but in actual fact is 5500.  Pls change these prices. It is annoying to order room service and be blindsided by a different price.

Review Title: A nice hotel, far from anything real in Lagos
Review Text: The Federal Palace Hotel is a nice place to stay, right on the waterfront, and with quite large grounds. Safely located on VI, it is far from the hustle and bustle of Lagos, and certainly provides a safe and sanitized stay in Nigeria's biggest city. The staff are very friendly, and the breakfast menu, in particular, is exceptional.  For some reason, the AC in the lobby/public areas is set very low, to the point that one has to wear a jacket or jumper at night in the restaurant.  I wish they did not do that.  My bedroom was clean and comfortable, although a noisy AC meant I had to use ear plugs at night.  This is a nice hotel, with clean facilities and helpful staff . . . but if you are visiting Lagos, wishing for a taste of the city and culture,  this is not the place to stay.

Coming to Nigeria for the first time I must say I was scared to say the least. But was I in for a suprised. I stayed here while doing Africa Fashion week, this was the most gorgeous and to say the least, most comfortable place ever. The staff were extremely helpful and the food was amazing! Lying on the beds around the pool was so relaxing. I would recommend this Hotel as a 5 star experience.

During my visit to Lagos  I stayed at federal palace a few nights. I was happy with the service and friendly staff both in the restaurant and casino. Being a first time visitor I felt very welcomed and nothing was an effort to the staff. The bedrooms are furnished emmaculately. I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay at.  Breakfast was well presented and there was a variety of dishes to choose from. Thank you to the management and staff for making my stay so pleasurable. Will most definitely go back on my next visit.

Tried the leisure facilities and have to admit they are the best in Victoria Island. The staff are very friendly and attentive. The slides are great for the kids and the Olympic sized swimming pool is perfect for adults who want to swim away the festive calories. The food is good, with a Lebanese touch, shawarma and hommous were good, only the sandwich was a little oily but taste was good.The cocktails are heavily priced and quite small in size but didn't grumble as they were made to perfection. The area is well spaced with a nice little mini golf area is there as well as a trampoline and  fitness area for adult who want to exercise. This is my second time here with my family, enjoyed it so much the first time my kids wanted to come back. We complained was told they were working on it, but till we left it didn't work. The breakfast is great but on boxing day (26th December), I don't know what happened I guess they were not ready for the crowd, the staff looked so disorganized and there was no food to eat. Review Title: A pleasant reminder of what customer service feels like
Review Text: The entire staff at the Federal Palace were friendly and accomodating. Very good customer service. It turned out to be a relaxing nice weekend getaway. Will stay here again.  My only complaints are the room service and ironing:  food delivery took a while and there are no irons or ironing boards in the room.

Review Title: Satisfying stay during a Business Trip
Review Text: The rooms are nice and spacious. The breakfast buffet is well laid out. Specially like the Chinese spread of stir fried noodles.  The only improvement that I would like to see in the room, is the provision of having Iron and Iron board so that business travelers like me can get the clothes ironed out before leaving for the day.

In November 2013 I spent 3 nights at the Federal Palace Hotel. I visit Lagos regularly for work and stayed in two other hotels before. Of the three hotels this is the best. Very pleasant staff, an excellent breakfast, small but very practical rooms, free and fast Wifi, located near my work location (important for me, but not for everybody :-)). I will certainly be back here on my next visits to Lagos

I had the pleasure of spending a week at Federal Palace during the month of October 2013.  I only have compliments for both the staff and the management. The rooms are spacious and are beautifully maintained.  Excellent free wifi, with great speed and quality. I was able to work from the hotel with no issues. The food, excellent quality and variety, both in room dining as well as the restaurant on property. I often ordered room service and it came quickly, and always with a smile.  The hotel environment is very quiet and the personnel very friendly and competent. As a female traveling on her own, I felt 100% safe all the time. The pool area is spectacular, fantastic pools and seating area, as well as the gym which is well equipped. Overall wonderful experience, and I would

We stayed at the federal for 5 nights at the end of September 2013 and we have stayed there over the years. To sum it up. Room 8/10 facilities 9/10 service 8/10 Overall it was the a wonderful relaxing time we really like the federal, but for a while the food has been very disappointing because of that we have thought of going to another hotel, I retried the food to see if it had improved but it had not. Such a lack of flavour really below average, so I rate it a 4/10. The breakfast is still good, I give it 7/10 So I hope the food improves, because  it's a shame to have such lovely facilities and yet you never want to eat there.

I traveled to Lagos on work and stayed at the Federal Palace. The hotel is a fine business hotel. The wi-fi connection is excellent. The rooms, though a little on the smaller side are comfortable. I had a sea facing room, which afforded nice views of the harbour. The staff is polite and helpful. The breakfast spread was large, but the food was not great.

I had the pleasure to spend nearly a month at Federal Palace while in Lagos for business, and I can only say good things about the hotel. Very nice appointed rooms, with big windows facing either the city or the busy harbor, and most importantly the rooms are spotless clean. Very good free wifi also, with great speed and quality, I was able to work from the hotel with no issues.The food is pretty good, I ordered often room service and it came quickly and with very good quality.
