Stayed for two days as a business traveller. Hotel is modern with comfortable rooms. Good responsive staff. Breakfast is okay, nothing great. Dinner buffet is bad, avoid it and order something from the a la carte or eat outside.

Review Title: Very tranquil & relaxing after a busy day at the office.
Review Text: Travelled for business to Lagos and stayed at the Federal Palace for the first time. I have stayed in another Hotel in Lagos but was really blown away by the friendly staff and hands on management to ensure that my stay is pleasant. I would definately recommend it for a change of scenery and superb customer service.

First class hotel. Really enjoyed my stay there. They put on an amazing breakfast and the dining facilities are excellent. Most amazing setting with outstanding views. Good gym facilities. Fantastic pool area.

Review Title: It works and is well run and bandwidth works-hallelujah!
Review Text: A rare find in lagos. Generous rooms, fantastic gardens, and extremely friendly staff. And for a change, unlike most business hotels, this one is not crawling with prostitutes. So you can actually order a coffee in the reception and you have not hot on a 'working girl' by accident.

Best breakfast in Lagos! We had a great trip... spacious lobby, rooms and best pool in Nigeria. Friendly service, not over the top. Great location on Victoria Island. Would definitely suggest for a visit to Lagos.

Very good service from all very friendly staff. Rooms excellent, food very good!!! We had a special meal request for the entire week of our stay,  the kitchen staff, room service and hotel management pulled out all the stops to cater to our every needs!!!  Well done, I will definitely stay here during my next trip.

Review Title: Recent Stay and the Federal Palace Hotel
Review Text: On a recent visit to Lagos, Nigeria I stayed at the Federal Palace Hotel. The rooms are large and comfortable and clean and well equipped. The bathroom was spacious and not lacking. The staff were friendly and genuinely eager to make the stay as memorable as possible.  The most notable part of my stay was breakfast! I am used to being a bit disappointed in breakfasts while travelling and I can honesty say that I have never had such a comprehensive and spectacular breakfast.  Finally the peripheral facilities were awesome with a large swimming pool and bar, tennis courts and and action golf course. I would most definitely stay here again.  Definitely the standards we have come to expect from Sun International.

Review Title: Great Hotel so far away from home
Review Text: Hotel was wonderfully accommodating. Staff were truly friendly and accommodate all my requirements even up to ordering room service at 4am. The breakfasts are spectacular and I have to say that the managers were so friendly and helpful - even offering water free of charge whilst waiting for the airport pick up. A lovely hotel to visit when in Nigeria.

Review Title: No better Hotel in Lagos than Federal Palace
Review Text: I was the leader of a South African business delegation to Lagos from 9 to 12 July 2013. Wow! what a great service we received at Federal palace. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby extremely spacious & convenient for business, the rooms big, neat, clean & super modern. The swimming pool is world class not only to swim but also as a play park for people with children,  their breakfast is delicious with so much variety to choose from. not to mention the level of client service from the security staff to receptionists and support staff. i admit, i have been travelling to Africa for the past 7 years and hardly get any such level of service. every one of the 18 businesses people in my group are unanimous that Federal palace is the best, and we are all looking forward to coming back

If you are staying on Victoria Island there are a number of options in hotels and B & B's. New ones coming in to the market every few months to match boomtown Lagos. No matter the stars, performance varies in line with staff and management. Sun International seems to manage a level of consistency that I have personally experienced over quite a few years. Well worth a look.

Excellent service, friendly staff and good food. Pool bar is luxurious with great view of the busy harbour. Comfortable rooms with huge beds. Another feature was the super fast wifi.  The only place to stay in Lagos!

Wow, what great service, truly a home away from home, the chefs top notch cooking with them going the extra mile to make you feel comfortable, pleasantly satisfied and ensure that you are satisfied with your meal is remarkable.  The stay at the hotel is unforgettable, the gorgeous view, great food, excellent service can you ask for more.

Review Title: Oasis of calm in busy Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed at Federal Palace several times over the last two years but I felt my most recent trip deserved a review. The security and setting of this hotel is unmatched in Lagos. The terrace overlooking the water is a relaxing place to unwind after long days spent in the frenzy of Lagos traffic. Whilst most decent hotels in Lagos are expensive, I don't mind paying for service and quality - both are evident at the hotel. Staff have consistently gone the extra mile to help with the small things like replacing a lost hairbrush or remembering my favorite newspaper.  As a female who often stays alone I have always felt safe, indeed the Management go out of their way to ensure their Guests feel at home, always on hand with advice and guidance. Review Text: Great hotel with lots of space and facilities, although it would be good if they had a spa; Its very family friendly as there is also a great water park and pool for both adults and kids, not to mention the gym. The selection of food and beverages is good and well-presented, and as for the staff, they are very polite & friendly, nothing is too much. After a hard day in the city, coming back to the hotel in the day/evening is calming and relaxing, one would never know you were in the heart of the city. Dining room can use some warmth, especially the breakfast buffet tables in the middle of the room don't help.  I was missing a mini bar in the room and some other 5 star comforts.  Probably needs to stretch a little further to deserve full 5 stars, but for a week's business travel, this hotel is an excellent option in Lagos.

Review Title: The best hotel for business travellers in Lagos
Review Text: I have stayed at this hotel maybe 15 times in the last 3 years and always look forward to coming back. The staff and management are, without exception, warm, friendly and attentive, welcoming me back each time as though I have come home! The hotel is far more spacious than many hotels in Lagos and the large lobby area is ideal for informal meetings, enhanced by the sense of calm around the place. The location is ideal for the VI business district. Breakfast, in particular, is good with a wide range of food and the service on the bar and terrace has improved considerably recently. I find there is nothing more relaxing in Lagos than sitting on the bar terrace in the evening watching the cargo ships go by... Rooms are good with very comfortable beds. Review Title: Very average, even by Lagos standards
Review Text: This hotel should be better frankly but seems to lacks strong management, despite being managed by the Sun International hotel group. Renovated and re-opened a few years ago, the rooms are already looking tired. Food is average at best and pretty awful at times. Room service one night took about 50 minutes.  Like all hotels in Lagos, it is significantly over-priced but seems to get a lot of South African business, perhaos because of the brand. I suspect that there is too much concentration/focus on the Casino - you certainly don't see active hands-on management in the hotel. Service standards were very mixed - pretty good at the over-priced bar but awful at check-in. Reasonably convenient for the business districts on Victoria Island.

Review Title: Reasonable for Lagos, pretty average and ridiculously overpriced by international standards
Review Text: Stayed here recently on a short business trip to Lagos. The hotel is well located for the Victoria Island business district with easy access to most major corporate HQs. Also excellent proximity to Lagos nightlife, restaurants etc . Impressively decorated lobby area and a rather nice bar and lagoon front terrace. Which makes the tiny, rather average rooms a bit of a disappointment. Service is extremely slow- it took ages to check in, I waited 45mins and 1 hour respectively for room service and over 40 mins for an adapter to be brought up to my room. On one occasion the kitchen called me after having waited over 30 mins to tell me what I had ordered wasn't available! Bathrooms could be cleaner and more luxurious for the price. Tiles need regrouting and hardware is almost retro.

This was my first trip to Lagos and after my airport experience and security escort, arrived here with a sense of dread. The architecture of the hotel is very old school, echoing its 1960 establishment and the former visions of pan-African glory - it was here that the country's declaration of independnece from Britain was signed. The grounds are pretty on the back, waterfront-facing side and quite lush, but the front is partly ruined by the now seemingly empty shell of the local secratariat tower that housed government officials before the capital moved to Abuja. Meticulous security at the gates does provide a sense of safety however.  The staff was extremely welcoming and check in while immediate, required the usual local formalities which took time. Review Title: Nice for a short stay - Good terrace view
Review Text: I stayed in the Federal Palace for a few days on a business trip. Check-in was extremely slow, and they mixed up the rooms for myself and  my colleague. They took her to the room that was under my name and vice versa. The lock on my door was broken and i requested to change it as soon as i was in the room - no one came to fix it for the whole day, after i came back to the room i had to come back down to request someone change it asap. The terrace though is amazing - the views of the garden are so beautiful and relaxing. Enjoyed a lovely drink there with my colleagues - very pleasant. Breakfast was also delicious - the f/b generally were very good.

Stayed for 4 nights while in Lagos on business. The hotel is immaculate. Very clean and modern. The room was medium large with new bathroom and comfortable king bed. Only complaint was the difficulty finding outlets for my business electronics.   Large comfortable lobby that was great for business meetings. A/C was strong...almost too much for locals. The bar was spacious with a nice buffet for lunch. The breakfast buffet was among the best I've had at any hotel, but not cheap... $30.  The pool was exceptional by Western standards. Probably the nicest in Nigeria. The gym was tucked away under the lobby. Equipment was new but limited.   I've stayed at the Radisson Blu and Eko in Lagos. Federal Palace is by far the best of the three.

I enjoyed a recent weekend booked in at the Federal Palace. I found when staying at the Federal Place it is as if you are far away from the hectic city life you experience in Lagos . The picturesque gardens, lovely terrace and magnificant pool area and all this overlooking the Lagos Lagoon and Harbour. The service is good, the food is very good and the staff on the whole are service orientated and friendly. The rooms are well furnished with everything in working order and the beds are so comfortable. The heavy curtains in the room boded well for late morning sleep ins. The casino is a great place with very friendly and professional staff.

Review Title: Very expensive for value of money
Review Text: My stay was ok. No complaints so far. Food was very very good actually. My only problem is the price. This is the most expensive hotel ive ever been too !! Price vs. Value is unacceptable to me. Why should I pay 400 usd per night. Any how I was informed that it is the best in nigeria. And the safest too.

It was recommended as the best Hotel in Lagos for our meeting and stay. The only impressive thing was the view of the Sea. However even this is taken away by dark heavy curtains covering the windows in the lobby. The service received was terrible. The restaurant used for dinner should not bother offering anything al a Carte. The salad ordered did not contain the items stated on the actual menu and came without dressing. We waited for nearly an hour to be served. The guest rooms smell damp as the AC is turned off completely when not occupied. The water in the wash hand basin, shower and bath is a muddy brown.

Review Title: A homelike atmosphere and truly fantastic staff
Review Text: I have stayed in this place quite a few times during numerous business trips to Lagos in the past three years. The rooms are quite spacious, and be sure to book one overlooking the garden and the waterfront - every now and then a grand ship would pass to and from the Lagos port, a scene, which proves to be quite spectacular for those who don't live on the seashores. Review Title: a fantastic place to stay in Lagos

The rooms are comfortable and the beds are fantastic - The bathrooms are nothing to write home about and are spotlessly clean.  Mine looked a little 'tired'.  One of my things disappeared from the room which I found very surprising. The bar is nice, the staff are friendly.  We organised an event there that went very well.  Food is good.

Review Title: Good choice for business and leisure
Review Text: It was my first stay at this hotel in Lagos and definitely it will become by first choice for coming trips, better than  the previously one tried in the city. The hotel is In Victoria Island and although is completely secure, you do not have the sense of being inside a prison as you do at other Lagos hotels. The hotel is surronded by large green extensions both  at back and front sides. The back one  gets to the water, so from the bar, restaurant or your room if you are lucky ( and I was!), you can see the ships permaently passing in both directions. Good bathroom with strong shower and warm water as soon as one opens the tap. The staff, at all levels very friendly and efficient; the ambiance of the hotel traditional, very well maintained and spotless. The breakfast buffet offered everything I need and lots more; the business lunch very good and quick. Only had dinner once but enjoyed the quality, presentation and service. I travelled on my own, and met up with my husband, who was already in Lagos on business. From the moment I arrived, I was treated like a queen! The Federal Palace had organised someone to meet me as I got off the plane, to see me through Customs and into a waiting vehicle to the hotel. Once I arrived, I was met by people intent on making my stay memorable! Overall, it is the warmest, most hospitable hotels I have stayed in. From the driver through to the top management, people were superb, food was divine, and I would go back for a holiday and take my kids in a heartbeat! I would highly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travel.

Huge hotel on sprawling grounds. While it's a "5" star hotel, it has no frills; no gowns or sleepers in roomsunless requested.The beds are not turned down as staff is not allowed into the guests' rooms unless the guest is in the room, as a result requests take long to be resolved. I would give it a 4 star rating. Rooms are of a decent size and the air conditioning worked well which is a necessity as it's hot and humid. Very expensive for what it offers. Food was surprisingly good at the restaurant.

Stayed here December 2010 and am only just getting round to writing a review. It was my first visit to Lagos after 20 years and I was pleasantly surprised. It's a great hotel if you want a quiet safe location. The food was excellent as we're the drinks. But it's certainly not a " party " hotel !! I will certainly stay here again on my next visit to Lagos.

Beautiful, I fact homely lobby.  Well kept rooms and fantastic sleep quality. I had to sacrifice myself.  The food is tasteless and actually worthless. I would eat them free.  I spent 3 nights but ate only one breakfast at their restaurant.  Overall, it's a cool environment but lacks those factors that make a hotel a star.

Really expensive, over-priced place. Nice lobby, friendly staff and reasonable rooms. Nothing too special except for the size - inside looks pretty grandiose and all. The External Boardroom at Federal Palace Hotel was used for our event.  The level of understanding of what we wanted was great, as well as the quality of the food, set-up and the speed of service.  The support, flexibility and promptness of the hotel staff was excellent.  Overall, we were all impressed and will definitely use Federal Palace again for future events and recommend  to friends and family.

The Federal Palace is a genuinely good hotel. For Lagos, and for the majority of Africa in fact, it is a tremendous hotel.  As with all hotels in this part of the world the price tag is rather steep, but the Federal Palace can get away with it as it is in my opinion the best Hotel in Lagos, with the Radisson closely behind.  The food was very good (a friend claimed to get food poisoning from the Dinner Buffet but it could have been from a multitude of sources).  The rooms were what you would expect from any global 'business-focused' hotel.  The service desk was as more efficient than most (but beware that relative to the rest of west Africa).  If you going to Lagos then stay here, you will be hard pressed to find somewhere better.

Second trip to Nigeria, staying at Federal Place for the first time. Location is great (VI) . Check-in process was really good - super fast and strangely enough they did not hold any money on the credit card or seek per-authorisation, which is what every other hotel I have stayed at does. The rooms are standard, I didn't have soap in my room on check-in. Additionally there was a major issue with hot water which sputtered out of the shower. Other than that its an OK hotel, with overpriced rooms, but this is Lagos so we deal with it. I would probably stay here again seeing as its a walking distance from my office.

As usual, the team at Federal Palace exceeded expectations and made my Client's event a Huge success. The Banquet & F& B team were dedicated throughout my event and their level of professionalism was appreciated throughout my stay in the hotel. I will definitely recommend FPH to other clients and will certainly use their external ballroom for future events.
Review Text

The Staff is well trained and conducts themselves very professionally. The safety and Security at the hotel is excellent and understands the needs of high profile individuals and their personal security arrangements.

Review Title: The only place to stay while you in Lagos
Review Text: Great hotel. I stayed at the federal Palace 3 time for about 2 weeks each time. and i really enjoyed the place and miss it when im back home. Realy excellent service, great food. Breakfasts always have so huge varieties and options. You will never get bored. This hotel will help you with business organisation (if you have any conferences or meetings) and also you can relax here. They have great pool, very big with waterslides. all staff is very friednly and very helful. Really reccommend this place!

Anyway, a great place. Clean, well laid out, well presented and friendly staff. The food is very good but comes at a well deserved premium. The rooms are very well appointed, large, airy and well decorated. There is a really big and cool veranda overlooking Lagos port

Now the hotel doesn't necessarily have the most happy-faced staff (some are downright dour), but they're generally polite. Whatever is lost to the countenance of staff, however, is more than made up for by the general atmosphere of this hotel - the decor is exquisite, the lobby expansive. The outside bar gives you a lovely view of the water. The return time for your orders may drag some, so I always order a drink to bide the time - it may well be what the whole idea is about! Went to Federal Palace for dinner during the week., I was pleasantly surprised. I have not been there in years so the renovation to the whole structure (at least from the lobby and restaurant) looked very good. The staff was not exactly friendly but they were very attentive and practically were always only a head nod away. The food was good and the drinks were ok. You pay to park but if you stay for a meal, then your ticket is stamped so you don't have to pay for parking any longer. The price is regular for Victoria Island but if you are from the mainland (or just any normal person) the prices can be steep. So unless you are loaded, the Federal Palace should be regarded as a nice place to hang out before heading out for the night and an occasional hunt if you want to treat

Review Title: Excellent family pool and play area
Review Text: The kids loved the slide next to the big pool, and were happy with the mini golf and trampoline. The baby loved the baby pool area and small slides. Nice outdoor comfortable beds, and cold drinks availalbe. Access restricted to hotel guests and club members, allowing some privacy and not many people around.

Secure, clean with friendly service and good breakfast buffet. Rooms are spaceous and clean and the beds comfortable. Avoid second floor rooms overlooking the rear as they have a great view of the air conditioning system.

There's no reason to spend money on flight tickets abroad for holidays because you can have everything at federal palace hotel and casino.This Vegas without the airfares. Its really a million thrills in one destination.

The Federal Palace is a very well appointed hotel on Victoria Island in Lagos. The hotel caters for both the business and tourist traveller and has very modern appointments with rooms that are very comfortable. The weather in Lagos can get to be very hot and humid most times but the air conditioning facilities of the hotel are very effective in keeping you cool.  The restaurant serves good food.

Review Title: Not bad for Lagos, expensive just like any other hotel in the area
Review Text: In any other more developed destination, be it for business or tourism, this hotel would be considered rubbish, but given that this is in Lagos, in Nigeria, it's not bad all. Sure, there's a few nigglets and imperfections, but overall it does the job: nice clean bed in a nice clean room in a nice clean hotel, and the restaurant is pretty good if you enjoy local food. Would stay again, but only if there's nothing better at the same prices...400-500 dollars a night would get you lovely spas anywhere else in the world, but again, TIA.
Review Text

I have been staying in hotels in Lagos for 4 years and the Federal Palace is easily my favourite.  Other hotels have now come into the market however there is always something wrong - either the air conditioning is too hot/ too cold with no ability to alter it, service is not good, food limited etc.  The Federal Palace has it all.  Yes, there are a few rough edges however the management are always visible and willing to assist wherever necessary.

I have stayed in different classes of hotels here in Nigeria and various other countries, and can say with certainty that this is one of the best hotels i have stayed in.  The rooms are excellently laid out and furnished/finished. The staff are quite polite. The food is great especially the breakfast - my most critical meal of the day. whether you preference is continental or local Nigerian cuisine, you are sure to be delighted.  This hotel is in the heart of Victoria Island and provides good security for any one visiting Lagos.

Great food with excellent choice at breakfast. Rooms great and comfortable. People good service and willing to help. Expensive but that's Lagos and any other big city for you. A good business hotel with lots of holiday facilities from pool to gym and more, though did not use these as I was on business.

Review Title: After trying a couple others, the best in lagos
Review Text: I've been to Lagos several times on business. stayed at 3 different hotel, Federal palace is the best of them. it's conveniently located in Victoria's island near most of the businesses, with a nice lobby, a good restaurant and a casino. it's especially good as you can't go out that much in Lagos because of security issues
I stayed at the federal palace and was amazed by the pool side view and nice hospitality

I have been travelling to Nigeria on business for the past 5 years, and during this period I have had the opportunity to visit many different hotels and venues. Having "discovered' the Federal Palace some years back, I quickly realized that this was by far and away the best choice in Lagos. The reasons to support this claim are evidenced by the way in which the management listen to guests concerns, and then actually act on them to improve the service. No lip service here! Once you have stayed more than once or twice, the staff will recognize you and welcome you back as if you were returning home! Most surprisingly perhaps is the fact that all staff actually take a genuine interest in your comfort and well being, and are quick in their efforts to ensure that you are looked after.
Loved the casino! Was a great time. Hotel is decent. Food was great. Pool was top notch. Try the traditional dishes.

I was there to see a friend and we stayed in the sea facing room.The Ancestors Bar had variety of drinks; I also had a chance to play in the las-vegas style casino. The food was good and the service was excellent. I'll definitely like to visit again.

Review Title: A Palace in the hub of the city
Review Text: My first visit to Federal Palace Hotel & Casino was a memorable one because it left me speechless. It's truely a palace in the heart of the city.

The hotel's location away from the hustle and bustle, of Lagos, made it a beautiful getaway for us all. While the hotel has excellent facilities in terms of its modern rooms as well as gym, pool club and casino; the staff of the hotel are also prompt in their sevice delivery to hotel guests. If you are lucky, you may also get to stay at one of the rooms overlooking the atlantic ocean.The Federal Palace's location is quite accessible to the cinema at Silverbed Galaria as well as the Lagos Barbeach.

I stayed at The Federal Palace for a month and absolutely loved my stay.  The grounds of the hotel are massive and beautiful.  The pool facilities are stunning with one of the best views of the waterway and beautiful ocean sunsets.  The breakfast buffet is first class as is the evening dining experience.  This is also one of the few hotels I have stayed at in the world where there are proper fitness facilities both indoors and outdoors to ensure that any serious fitness enthuist can stay in tip top shape.  Overall, I really enjoyed my stay and certainly  would recommend to anyone travelling to Lagos to stay at The Federal Palace.
I had a pleasant experience staying at the hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were great. The breakfast was fantastic. I loved my experience.

Review Title: Upmarket, clean, good food, good service, good facilities
Review Text: I recently stayed at the Federal Palace Hotel with my husband.  I was there only for a few days so i could view schools and apartments as we intend to move there in April on a 2 yr contract. I was really impressed with this hotel definitely worth its star rating! The breakfast selection is large as well as the buffet dinner they offer.  It has a comfortable bar area and outside tables. The rooms are a decent size and come with all the added extras to make the stay comfortable. My husband has stayed at 3 hotels on Victoria Island and this is by far the best.

Review Title: Definetly the best in Lagos - Nigeria
Review Text: I lived in Lagos for a while. Now I go back and forth at least 5 times a year. Federal Palace has lifted the bar up. This hotel has shown people what a great hotel is supposed to look like. The rooms are not so big but rather very comfy. Clean and neat. The swimming pool is great. They have the best casino in Lagos.The view of the lagoon is great. Although not so great on the 2nd or 3rd floor. Now, about the yellow water. I did realize the water was yellow for about 3 days of my 8 days stay. But its ok. All in all, the hotel is the best place to stay in Lagos.

Review Title: Certainly one of the best hotels in Lagos
Review Text: I recently spent about 10 days in the Federal Palace and found the hotel to be a wonderful departure from the average West African hotel experience.  The room was clean and well appointed, the restaurant and bar were both very good and they just opened what must be one of the nicest hotel pool complexes in Africa.  The service was attentive, the staff accommodating and I didn't have any problems with my credit card.  Wireless and wired internet connections. Their fitness center was decent as well, though I didn't use it. There's also a casino in the hotel that I didn't make it into.

I enjoyed my five nights at the Federal Palace Hotel.  The staff went out of their way to greet and help everyone, the place is pristine, and the food is great.  The hotel hosted a Jazz Festival during my stay and it was relaxing to hang out at the pool.  The hotel geatures a large pool, long waterslides, an 18 hole mini-golf course, trampolines, fitness park, and play area for the kids.  The gym is one of the nicest i have seen in Africa at a hotel and overall the hotel was impressive and i would highly recommend it to others.  The bath water was still yellow and the wifi was weak, but it didnt feel like i was in Africa here.

This hotel is much better than the Eko Suites.  The food was good and the workout facility above average.  This is a pricey hotel with small rooms, but it is very comfortable. If not for the water issue I would rate this hotel very good.

Review Title: The best hotel in Lagos, but at a heavy price
Review Text: I have been travelling to Lagos on business for the last 15 years, staying in a wide range of over-priced and sub-standard accommodation. Without a doubt the Federal Palace, since its refurbishment and the assumption of operational control by South African management, is the best hotel I have stayed in in Lagos. The foyer is large and suitable for informal meetings. The rooms are on the small side, but well furnished and very clean. The beds are supremely comfortable and the bed linen is of high quality.
